answer:
We recommend that you contact your local public health unit or doctor as soon as possible so that your child can be assessed to determine if treatment (which may include getting the tetanus vaccine) is required. Tetanus-containing vaccines are available from public health units. 
- Immunization Nurse
question: My son scratched himself on a nail and I want to get a tetanus shot. Can I take him to a public health unit?
question_variation_0: where can i have a shot for scratching himself on nail
question_variation_1: can i take my son for tetanus shot?
question_variation_2: can my son get tetanus shot at hospital if scratched nail
